A modified offline version of starsearcher or "Persean Commercial Realty Group"
items.summary:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
items.description:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
1. Search for planets based on certain conditions (resources etc)
2. Search for planets based on distance to core world
3. Show a flag to indicated if a planet has a gate or domain comm array in the system
4. Increase the search timeout to 120 seconds
5. Fixed a bug that causes all planets' ruin conditions show as "Scattered Ruins" 
6. Display Techmining Multplier; if the text is bold, the ruin has not been explored - June 13, 2023
7. Add some exception handling when reading the save file, probably better compatibility with mods. If you have some issue with your save, send it to me and I would take a look. - June 20, 2023
8. Added a filter for planet type - September 15, 2023
Forum link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=27210.0

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: *Requires 0.96a-RC10+*
items.description:
*Requires 0.96a-RC10+*

**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Features:     
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat or on the campaign map
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes
- Create your own default tags with the option to automatically apply them
- Customize most aspects of the mod through an extensive settings file
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

```
Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.
```
AGC in 60s (Youtube): https://youtu.be/2T3xNqy2HQA
AGC in-depth (Youtube, long and rambly, watch at 1.5~2x speed): https://youtu.be/WRH66z4EYcc
AGC showcase (Youtube, slightly outdated): https://youtu.be/Zg4sxRj9V8I

items.name: Better Variants
items.summary: A mod that aims to make combat more interesting and challenging by adding preset variants, officers, and fleet compositions for the vanilla factions.
items.description:
A mod that aims to make combat more interesting and challenging by adding preset variants, officers, and fleet compositions for the vanilla factions. 

Features include:
- Disabling autofit for most vanilla factions
- New and reworked ship variants
- Officers in npc fleets receiving skills relevant to the ship they are piloting
- Randomly occurring, themed fleets with unique compositions

Safe to add, not safe to remove. Requires MagicLib and version 0.4.0 of Variants Lib

items.name: Captain Trek's Guide to the Modiverse - Updated 28/05/20
Captain's Log
items.summary: Write custom log messages. Automatically generates intel reports for unexplored ruins, salvageable ships, hypershunts, cryosleepers, and more.
items.description:
Write custom log messages. Automatically generates intel reports for unexplored ruins, salvageable ships, hypershunts, cryosleepers, and more.

Changelog:

```
- Add GUI with multi-line text editing for writing Captain's Log custom messages
  - Accessible from the control panel in the intel screen or using the shortcut (default P) in the campaign
- Automatically log the location of Comm Relays located outside the Core Worlds
- Automatically log the location of Coronal Hypershunts
- Add version checker changelog support
- Add LunaLib support
- Add LunaLib settings to enable/disable each type of automated intel logging
- Add LunaLib settings to set whether Captain's Log custom log messages should be marked as important by default
- Rework intel reports to more closely follow vanilla style
- Removed console command support (most functionality ported to GUI functions)
- Change ignore hotkeys to use g rather than i
- Updated salvageable ship intels to use the ship sprite as the icon rather than the map icon
- Fix bug that allowed players to use "lay in course" button to repeatedly salvage the same object.
```

**First 0.96a version, not compatible with any 0.95.1a version recompiled for 0.96a**

items.name: DIY Planets - Terraforming and more! Community Edition
Desperta Ferro
items.summary: A faction/ship/weapon mod. Featuring a high tech nation called the Jupitriss Union who espouses enlightenment via technology, but could be considered to be nothing more than raiding techno-pirates.
items.description:
A faction/ship/weapon mod. Featuring a high tech nation called the Jupitriss Union who espouses enlightenment via technology, but could be considered to be nothing more than raiding techno-pirates. 

Adds:
-24 Brand newly resprited not-so vanilla adjacent ships, 14 new fighter wings, 28 new weapons. and 20+ custom portraits. Custom Sounds, with unique effects, market music, star system, and deep codex lore.
-Don't want to join the Union? Raid their fortified star system for rare loot.
-The Union is a carrier focused faction with high flux pools, PD beams built into hulls, and an energy/missile focus. This is contrasted by their paper thin hull and armor, and high OP costs to their deployment and weapons.

Not save compatable!

I hope you enjoy it!

items.name: Dynamic Tariffs
items.summary: I've rewritten DynamicTariffs for fun, and added the much requested feature of NOT using the whitelist in the `settings.json`
items.description:
I've rewritten DynamicTariffs for fun, and added the much requested feature of NOT using the whitelist in the `settings.json`

For the uninitiated this mod changes your tariffs in markets based on your relationship with the given faction who owns the market.

Any modifications to the tariffs are erased when you close the market which makes this a utility mod (can install/remove at any time).

Download: https://github.com/jsbursik/DynamicTariffs/releases/tag/2.0

items.name: EHM: Experimental Hull Modifications v0.8.3
items.summary:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
items.description:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
**FOREWARNING**
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.

**Hull Modifications:** Will become available immediately
• Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
• Over-Engineered: Provides 15% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
• Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
• Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
• AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

**Hull Modification Categories:** Will become available immediately
• Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
• Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
• Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
• Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

**Slot Shunt Categories:** These are utilities that can be equipped on weapon slots. Each require its own activator to do what it's supposed to do. May be obtained after activating the new ability
• Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
• Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
• Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
• Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
• Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
• Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

```diff
Requires LunaLib & LazyLib
+ Save compatible; safe to install/update
- Cannot be removed; back your save up
```
Release & Changelog: <https://github.com/lyravega/lyr_ehm/releases/>
Forum Thread: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24291>

items.name: Exotica Technologies
items.summary:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
items.description:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
Exotica Technologies offers an RPG element to Starsector that makes your ships AND enemies harder, better, faster, stronger through upgrades and exotics! These upgrades do not take OP or hullmod slots! Each ship has a limit to the number of upgrades they can install so choose wisely! The cost of each upgrade will require common materials salvaged across the sector such as metal and transplutonics. However, as upgrades get more complex and specialized, they tend to consume more resources and even demand special items found through research stations and mining stations!

Changelog in latest post. **1.6.0 makes the game harder.**
This mod requires MagicLib, LazyLib, LunaLib, and **the latest version of Combat Activators**.

Save compatible with all previous versions of Exotica and can be added mid-save with no loss of functionality, even for salvage exploration. This mod does not affect drops of other exploration items, namely colony items, and are rolled completely separately.
Download: https://github.com/scardwell15/ExoticaTechnologies/releases/download/v1.6.8/Exotica-Technologies-v1.6.8.zip
Forum:  https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=24660.0

Illustrated.Entities
items.summary: `Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`
items.description:
`Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`

Adds images to all vanilla planets, a way to change them, 500+ AI-generated illustrations to choose from for your own colonies, and allows you to edit and add descriptions to your own planets with an in-game UI.

VRAM-Impact is around 70 mb during normal gameplay because the mod only loads images that you look at. 
However, it cannot un-load them, so VRAM use can be up to 250mb depending on your actions. Restarting the game will clear the image cache.

items.description:
`A massive campaign content expansion for colonies and exploration.`

Industrial Evolution aims to deepen the colonisation and exploration aspect of the game, bringing new gameplay features not available anywhere else, to support whatever playstyle you choose.
Can not be installed on an ongoing save.

```diff

3.3.c
Fixed all the problems with specialized industries

3.3.b
Fixed the immortal artillery
Fixed the Pet Store soft brick when pressing esc
Added images to most pets
Added a larp mode to governments, making them cosmetic

3.3.a
Added 33 Pets
Added 5 Planet Governments
Added 4 new World Wonders
LunaLib Settings integration
Too many bugfixes and improvements to list, check the forum changelog.
``````diff
+ SAVE COMPATIBLE WITH 3.3
- Can NOT be installed on an ongoing save
This means: The mod can't be added if it was not present on game start, but the update is safe to install over the old one if you started the save with IndEvo 3.3 present.

Loulan Industries 1.8.6
items.summary: A PL breakaway faction with a varied lineup of ships, weapons, and fighters.
items.description:
A PL breakaway faction with a varied lineup of ships, weapons, and fighters.

While Loulan ships cover a wide variety of design philosophies, they all benefit from the same "LLI Protocol" hullmods which can either offer unique bonuses or simple stat increases. Furthermore, the "Cliff System" common to all of their ships enhances a ship's performance based on its flux level.

Changelog for 1.8.3:
```
1 new fighter
1 new ship
1 new weapon

Loulan fighters on Traverser ships get altered paintjob to match Traverser's

Seaquake has been resprited (overall weapon mounts remain the same)
Meteorologist system reworked, renamed to "Vectored Eruption Drive"
System Reboot reworked and renamed into "Phase Transfer Field"

Various stat buffs/nerfs
```

items.summary: Need a faction with 10 plus capitals? Come here! <:fac_mayasura:648933870074331155>  <:skySsmug:1102191752531685416>
items.description:
Need a faction with 10 plus capitals? Come here!   

10.0.0 RC2
-Fixed Didymoi Minelayer
New missile behavior means it activates as soon as it gets in range rather than a timer. While unfortunate, I can't change this I think.
-Added pass through to the Mark VII projectiles, Caliburnus Railgun projectiles, Charged UV Pulse Cannon Projectiles.
These are all big projectiles with a lot of damage. So have fun sniping multiple fighters at once!
-Increased refire time of Mark VII to 12 seconds.
-Increased refire time of Armored Box Launcher to 12 seconds.
Both of these weapons will be keeping their massive alpha damage, however, you will have to be more deliberate with your shots.
-Increased the damage of the Orbital Howitzer from 1200 to 2000.
With how unwieldy this gun is, it deserves MORE damage.

https://github.com/KnightShii/Starsector/raw/master/Mayasuran%20Navy%2010.0.0%20RC2.7z

items.name: Moar XIV
items.summary: Hello Ladies and gents, aliens and good old organ traders. Here is the Moar XIV pack, an XIV pack that brings more XIV into the game for XIV bloat, featuring XIV.
items.description:
Hello Ladies and gents, aliens and good old organ traders. Here is the Moar XIV pack, an XIV pack that brings more XIV into the game for XIV bloat, featuring XIV. 

Feel free to send your own or ownerless ship sprites that you love and want a poor XIV cope recolour of, currently working on improving the quality of my recolouring. (feel free to dm me about an issues or sprites)

I attempted to make the ships balanced but I simply eyeballed the stats based off of vanilla ship stats for the same weight class and sprung from there because I dont have the motivation at the moment to dig into so many different mod folders to find the exact numbers. 
If anyone wants to volunteer to dig around for this information on your own, i would be very grateful

Quality Captains
items.summary:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, competitive choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. Every skill has been carefully tuned to maximize its potential by curating the good effects and adding the best from previous game versions. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft.
items.description:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, competitive choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. Every skill has been carefully tuned to maximize its potential by curating the good effects and adding the best from previous game versions. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft. 

Every skill is balanced against all the others and which you select will change your battles and your adventures.
 
Also makes ECM and Navigation battle effects way more fun.

Version 1.5 introduces a **perk system** with milestones that your character automatically unlocks as they progress through the story. These milestones include powerful QOL features and most of the effects are completely fresh to the modiverse. 

**Enjoy! Download is below ** or through the thread.
NB: To update from versions before 1.5, use uninstall mode, save, then update and toggle uninstall off. DM me if you run into trouble. 

Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21038.0

items.name: Refit Filters
items.summary: A Hullmod that filters weapons according to certain characteristics.
items.description:
A Hullmod that filters weapons according to certain characteristics.

Adds a single new hullmod that applies filters to the refit weapon menu. A Spiritual successor to ruddygreat's Filter Hullmods.

The following filters are currently implemented.
- Damage type
- Range
- Beam / Projectile
- Point Defense / Non Point Defense

San-Iris ships are made to defend their home world and as such are very defense oriented. The ship emulate biological life in their design, with high armor and low hp, they have a bonus in flux dissipation but get weaker as hull go down.

items.name: Second Wave Options (discord pre-release)
items.summary:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```
items.description:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```

# Current Features
- 🧾 Book of Grudges (negative rep with factions--and optionally players--lingers)
- 🔫 Autofit Tweaks (super minor, just reduces autofit randomness atm)
- 🏴‍☠️ Pirate Scholars (now they can learn things automatically! 🤓 )
- 📗 Blessed By Ludd (gives LP ships a chance to suppress Ill-Advised Mods)
- 👑 Make Sindria Great Again (gives LG and Diktat ships a chance to suppress Special Modifications)
- 📈 Doctrine Scaling (your favorite feature from last time, maybe, now better, maybe! if you're new here it means factions now scale, pog?)
- 📉 Commodity Scaling (silly, experimental way of reducing the amount of commodities you can purchase in markets. stop engaging in arbitrage and go kill things)
- 📵 No Free Storage (disables the free storage in the three abandoned stations in the Core Worlds. Ones outside the Core aren't affected, should they exist 👀)
- 🔐 Secure Markets (that other feature that at least one person liked, more or less the same! markets have defenses and stations and in some cases, annoying patrols!)

if you give me cool, easily implemented ideas, they probably won't get added to the mod! (but i promise i'll think about it)

- **Everything is togglable and editable in LunaLib**, which is pog.
   - you can turn everything off and have a mod that does nothing!!
- **Should be safe to add and remove at any point**, which is very pog.
   - but i didn't mark it utility so don't blame me for anything ty
- **If you download this mod, I will like you at least a little bit more than if you didn't**, and really, what could be more pog than that?
   - *terms and conditions apply*

# Links
- Forum: outdated 
- Download: **https://github.com/RustyCabbage/SecondWaveOptions/releases/download/v1.2.1-rc1/SecondWaveOptions-v1.2.1-rc1.zip**
- Source: <https://github.com/RustyCabbage/SecondWaveOptions/>

items.name: Take No Prisoners v0.16.1
items.summary:
Take enemy officers captive, learn their story and hire them!
` `
items.description:
Take enemy officers captive, learn their story and hire them!
` `
Take No Prisoners offers a narrative experience that most mods do not by allowing you to take enemy prisoners captive and actually have a one-on-one conversation with them rather than picking a dialog option that just gives you free money. Most vanilla factions have their own defined dialogues as part of this mod, so the prisoners you capture will be different across factions, and sometimes even within factions!

Phillip Andrada: Gas Station Manager has an extensive amount of content added if this mod is installed.

Changelog:
```
0.16.1 - update dialog methods to use dialog's interaction target's active person first if all of those exist
0.16 - updated for 0.96a, with new license
```

Download: https://github.com/scardwell15/takenoprisoners/releases/download/v0.16.1/TakeNoPrisoners-v0.16.1.zip

items.description:
Adds a group of time-altering mafia families to the sector.

Adds the Vass Families (or rather, only one of them at the moment) to the sector, as well as a small line of missions related to seeking out their services. Their ships and weapons mainly rely on strange manipulation of spacetime itself, though the families tend to want to hoard such secrets for themselves...

items.name: Vexx's Bonus Content
items.summary:
A bunch of XIV'd modded boats, a handful of weapons painted orange and black, and a pile of symmetrical doritos for a quest chain I've not started yet.
All modded ships used with permission, thanks to Connortron for the Catapult, to G4R5vb5r3H for the Pankrator and Chokeslam names, to Tart for the Gryphon (XIV), and Nes for the Hammerfall! You're all Cool Dudes ™️
items.description:
A bunch of XIV'd modded boats, a handful of weapons painted orange and black, and a pile of symmetrical doritos for a quest chain I've not started yet.
All modded ships used with permission, thanks to Connortron for the Catapult, to G4R5vb5r3H for the Pankrator and Chokeslam names, to Tart for the Gryphon (XIV), and Nes for the Hammerfall! You're all Cool Dudes ™️

*"Admiral, what... Are, all of those?*"
*"A bunch of weird back orders."*

Notes:
I am not a big Numbers Man. I heartily accept input on numbers.

Yes, the Lord is silly. 

If you tell me the Doritos are overpowered or shouldn't be symmetrical, I will laugh, agree with you, and do nothing about them- They're there to be overpowered and fun, and aren't normally accessible. The quest they'll belong to (eventually) will be very post game.

Yes the fixed smalls on the Turul and Harpy Eagle are universals. You're going to put missiles on them anyway. 

Tell me about bugs you find! Please! *I have no idea what I'm doing but I'm willing to learn!*

An enormous thank you to the starsector community for giving me somewhere to be and something to focus my effort on. You're all Cool Dudes ™️

Especially thanks to Laharl; the myth, the legend, the person who *wholesale taught me how to mod this game.* I never would have got this far without you. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JG6Ejkez_D8GQ8MNX6dDlLY4lFwMne2B/view?usp=sharing

```Changelog: Version 1
released mod```

items.name: Volantian Reclamation Initiative 0.4a "CIWCOTPMIARARRARRWRARMMC"
items.summary: The Volantian Reclamation Initiative is the newly-reformed successor to an ancient, long dead polity with deep roots in the Persean Sector. Set to reclaim their heritage, they utilize a variety of reverse engineered, ancestral, and scavenged technology.
items.description:
The Volantian Reclamation Initiative is the newly-reformed successor to an ancient, long dead polity with deep roots in the Persean Sector. Set to reclaim their heritage, they utilize a variety of reverse engineered, ancestral, and scavenged technology.

Adds a wide variety of ships, weapons, unique characters, industries, and oddities to be found around the sector, alongside a faction!

Thank you, everyone, for your continued support!

**Please fill out this user feedback form!!!**
<https://forms.gle/zzjSWe9b2B3j8nQo8>

```Changelog:
-Fixed VI Description and Hullmod bonuses
-Added Glare-Class heavy cruiser
-Added alpha core bonuses for Volgen and Aegis industries
-Fixed too small scintilla (vri) mounts
-Added a unique bar event
-Gave Milasha and Blanche contact tags so they offer normal missions
-Added a new oddity system to find in the sector
-Gave the Trident proper weapon typing, now affected by weapon and range modifiers```

0.3.1b Download:<https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1071562139975811112/1117521239846682684/Volantian-Starsector-Mod.zip>

Requires Graphiclib, Lazylib, and Magiclib.
Should be update and save compatible.

items.name: WhichMod
items.summary: Puts the name of the mod that added a ship, fighter, weapon, or hullmod in the description.
items.description:
Puts the name of the mod that added a ship, fighter, weapon, or hullmod in the description. 

Pretty simple to use- just turn it on. There are some options in the mod's config file if you prefer to use abbreviations for mods instead of their full names.

```Changelog:
- 1.2.2 is just a version number change for 0.96 compatability. I will (eventually) add support for industries and ship skins, since 0.96 should enable that.```

direct download: https://github.com/theDragn/whichmod/releases/download/1.2.2/WhichMod_1.2.2.zip
forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=22367.0
